If Mouse Released: This action checks for when a mouse button has been released. It will return true on the single game step (frame) that the mouse button is released on and false at all other times. If you enable the not modifier, this action will be reversed, and check if the mouse button has not been released, returning false on the game step (frame) that it has been released on and true at all other times.

The above action block code polls the mouse button state every step and if it is being held down it checks for the initial mouse down press. If the check is <tt>true</tt> on the initial down press the instance speed is set, then, while the button is down, the sprite blending is changed to red. If the mouse is not being held down, a check is done on the mouse release to reset the blending colour to white and set the speed to 0.
